name: tainting
content:

present participle of
taint
to spoil something or give it an unpleasant quality: His reputation was permanently tainted by the financial scandal. He warned of toxins such as mercury tainting some fish.
More examplesFewer examplesHis first term of office was tainted by scandal.We don't want people out there tainting our reputation.It was found that the groundwater had been tainted with a string of toxins.
